# Budweiser Case Study
## 

### Load Libraries
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```
### Load in the data
```{r}
beers <- read.csv("beers.csv", header = T)
breweries <- read.csv("breweries.csv", header = T)
```

### Look at the data
```{r}
str(beers)
str(breweries)
head(beers)
head(breweries)
```

### How many NAs 
```{r}
ABV_NAs <- sum(is.na(beers$ABV))
IBU_NAs <- sum(is.na(beers$IBU))
#make data frame from number of NAs
NA.df <- data.frame(rbind(ABV_NAs,IBU_NAs))
names(NA.df)[1] <- "NAs"
NA.df$NAs <- as.character(NA.df$NAs)
#plot the NA values
ggplot(NA.df, aes(x=y=NAs)) +
  geom_bar()
```

### How many breweries in each state
```{r - Number 1}
ggplot(breweries, aes(x=State)) +
  geom_bar(fill="blue") +
  theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=90)) +
  ggtitle("Number of Breweries by State") +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("Count")
```

#merge datasets on Brewery_id
```{r}
names(breweries)[1] <- "Brewery_id"
df1 <- merge(beers, breweries, by = "Brewery_id", all = T)
df1
```



```{r - Number 5}
df2 <- df1[order(df1$ABV,decreasing = T),]
df2 <- df2[c(1,2,3,5,6),c(4,10)]
df3 <- df1[order(df1$IBU,decreasing = T),]
df3 <- df3[c(1:5),c(5,10)]
ggplot(df3, aes(x = reorder(State, -IBU), y = IBU, fill = State)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  ylim(0,150) +
  ggtitle("Top 5 States IBU") +
  xlab("State") +
  geom_text(aes(label=IBU), vjust=-1)
ggplot(df2, aes(x = reorder(State, -ABV), y = ABV, fill= State)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  ylim(0,0.15) +
  ggtitle("Top 5 States ABV") +
  xlab("State") +
  geom_text(aes(label=ABV), vjust=-1)
```



```{r - Number 6}
#Summary stats of ABV
summary(df1$ABV)


###Distributions
#Histogram of ABV in df1 - looks decent
df1 %>% ggplot(aes(x=ABV)) + geom_histogram(fill = "blue") + ggtitle("Distribution of Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)") + labs(x="Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)", y="Frequency")

#boxplot - might need some work
df1 %>% ggplot(aes(x=ABV)) + geom_boxplot(fill = "blue") + ggtitle("Distribution of Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)") + labs(x="Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)", y="")

boxplot(x=df1$ABV)



#geom_density - looks decent
ABV_vizz = ggplot(df1, aes(x = ABV))

ABV_vizz + geom_density(aes(y = ..count..), fill = "blue", alpha=0.6) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept = mean(ABV)), 
             linetype = "dashed", size = 0.6,
             color = "#FC4E07")
```



